body: I believe @satya-pattnaik was working on a prototype, although I notice we haven't agreed on or merged the STEP.
in the meeting, @danbartl has proposed an alternate design or process based on gradual change rather than new base class. He'll summarize, issue for that is #1684.

issue.title: [ENH] Test scenarios for advanced testing

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR introduces a class `TestScenario` which models a script to run methods sequentially with certain arguments and retrieve the outcome, plus a check whether the script is applicable to an object (e.g., estimator).

This addresses a deficiency in the current testing framework, in that unit tests can retrieve only a single argument combination per estimator scitype, via the `_make_fit_args` etc family of functions.

This limitation prevents addressing a few existing and future testing requirements:

* testing two subsequent `fit` calls with different arguments, #1613. The current tests are incapable of passing two different sets of arguments to the same method.
* testing forecasters both with only `y` argument and with `y` and `X` argument #1674. The current tests did not detect side effects on `X` since only `y` were passed, and it is not possible to use two different sets of arguments.
* the transformer refactor which allows all transformers to accept both `Series` and `Panel` inputs, requiring us to test both types of inputs #1740. This would be very hard in the current framework.
* same for extending forecasters to global/hierarchical #1683 (or #1684), which will also see forecasters accepting multiple input scitypes, `Series` and `Panel` and `Hierarchical`.

After this PR, the class would be used to replace existing testing functionality, and write new tests easily.

This PR also contains tests for the `TestScenario` functionality.

issue.title: [ENH] Define critical interface points for multi-index data containers in forecasting

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

body: Ultimately, we went with the "modification" route as described in #1684 - the for review prototype and near-final implementation is in #1818.
